The documentation at the following locations indicates that the configuration of GreenHopper can be used to allow either the 'Resolve Issue' or 'Schedule Issue' permission to be used to control ranking. This isn't the case any more, the schedule issue permission is now required. Could we please update this? 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Specifying+your+General+Configuration
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ranking+an+Issue
fields.summary: Documentation refers to 'Resolve Issue' being usable as a ranking permission, this isn't the case any more

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to add a quick filter which displays a drop-down for all possible values for a field.  For example, I'd like to add a filter based upon Epic/Theme or Fix Version - the latter would work just like the Fix Version filter on the task board.

This is similar to the request to be able to create swimlanes based upon all the possible values for a field (GHS-4669)

fields.description: Currently uses default settings, not stored settings.

fields.description:
Phase 1. Allow for a 'useStoredSettings' flag, which sets the rapid view from the URL, but then pulls all other settings from local storage.

Phase 2. Allow for selective inclusion of some fields, but overriding the rest with local storage (instead of defaults). This is to allow for the case where something links to a work mode for a given view, selects a specific issue, but doesn't override other settings.
fields.summary: As a 3rd party developer, I would like to be able to link to a GH board and specify some settings (but have the other settings come from storage, rather than defaults)

fields.description:
See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Ability+to+Sort+Resolved+or+Closed+Issues.

The default JIRA workflow makes closed/resolved issues uneditable. This is a historical thing with JIRA; before GH, it made sense. One way to achieve this would be change the default workflow (or go through the workaround), but perhaps GreenHopper could ignore this JIRA setting.
fields.summary: Ability to sort closed or resolved issues

* Create issue and it is visible -> select the issue
* Create issue and it is not visible -> show a popup

fields.summary: As a user, I'd like the issue I just created on a board to be the selected issue by default, or to get a popup indicating it was created if the issue is not visible

As an owner, I would like the ability to edit a sprint after it has started

fields.description:
*Brief*
As a scrum master, I have the task of putting together the next sprint. As we have so many stories to choose from, I need a way for myself and the product owner to sit down and see all these stories in one place and organise some kind of priority that can then help me put a sprint together.

I currently use a physical card wall for this task where I have all the story cards posted, grouped by the next couple of sprints then the rest as a backlog underneath. the cards are also grouped by component from left to right on the wall.

I would rather use GreenHopper to help me achieve, we already use it for tracking the current sprint quite successfully but find it difficult to prioritise the backlog by just looking at one long list or one version or component at a time. 

I have created a mock of what I think the card wall view in greenhopper could look like. Please find attached two PDF's one with and the other without comments

*Conditions of satisfaction*
* the issues are laid out in a grid view as cards, similar to the way sub tasks on the task board
* the cards should display in rank order with the highest priority listed at the top
* you can drag stories up and down to change its rank, highest is most priority similar to regular planning board view

* the cards should be grouped by version
* versions are displayed in date order with the earliest version listed highest and the latest at the bottom along with an unscheduled group.
* i can choose how many issues i see on a page, per version and column before it paginates
* I can hide versions I don't want to deal with. We use versions for tracking sprints and releases and I am only interested in organising new sprints so want to hide the release versions

* I can see how many story points are currently in a version
* I can set a limit on how many story points should be in each version which would be the team's velocity
* If a version has too many story points in it then it should clearly indicate this so issues can be manually moved

* you can drag stories between versions and it automatically adjusts the fixVersion
* when the fix version is updated, it only removes the previous version and adds the new one, leaving any onther versions that story was part of, still there.

* It should be possible to arrange the issues into columns
* I can choose to arrange the columns by Component, assignee or just one big column
* I can reorder the columns to put the most important components or assignees first, furthest left, and the least important further right

* I can choose to center the view around story points or ideal hours when dealing with velocity, I personally would use story points
* the story point value or ideal hours of each card is clearly visible
* I can quickly set the team's velocity in bulk for all future versions so I can get an idea if more or less issues can be added to future versions

* there should be a minimum width of each column so that the issues remain readable, and a horizontal scrollbar should allow you have more columns than can fit on the screen at the same time
* the version should remain on the screen when scrolling horizontally so you never forget which versions your looking at
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I can switch to a Card Wall view on the planning board where I can prioritise backlog stories and schedule them in future sprints

fields.description: The Rapid board should support looking at previous sprints and story points/issues completed in them for reporting and assessing velocity.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board Admin, I would like to see previous sprints and story points/issues completed in them.

fields.description:
As mentioned in the [docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Releasing+a+Version], Project Administrator permission is required. This is not great from a security perspective as anyone that can release could mess up (unintentionally) all the project config.

| You will need to have the JIRA 'Project Administrator'

We should be able to use the Permission Schemes to assign specific groups the role to create release versions and release via Rapid Board.
fields.summary: Allow non project admin users to release from Rapid Board

fields.description: With the introduction of Global Rank it is now possible to rank issues on the Rapid Board.  Unfortunately if I am viewing issues outside of the Rapid Board there is no way to change the rank.  The only other place in JIRA where we can see the relative position of issues is the Issue Navigator, so this would be the natural place to put this functionality.  Ranking issues often requires seeing more information than is available in a single view on the Rapid Board so, again, the Issue Navigator seems like a good place for this functionality.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to change the Global Rank of an issue from the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
When you set the Dashboard gadgets to 'Auto' they will show the sprint (version) with the latest release date. Even if that is a sprint in the future. 

About a day or two before sprint planning I (and probably most people) come in and start planning the next sprint (adding versions, etc). 

The 'Auto' feature would more naturally select the version with the latest release date that is *NOT* started in the future. This would be much more expected behavior for "Auto". And it would release the planners from having to work around the problem by not setting the release date until the morning of the sprint start. uggggg
fields.summary: Dashboard gadgets using 'Auto' to pick the current sprint pick future sprints, not logical behavior

fields.summary: GreenHopper Planning Board and Task Board should use the JIRA 5 Quick Edit

fields.description:
Do the following actions in the rapidboard:
1) Go to the detail view of an item.
2) Close the detail view
3) Select (do not open it) another item in the rapid board 
=> Use a shortcut such as 'A' to assign. This will now open a form to assigna user to the previously selected item (from step 1).
fields.summary: Selection bug in rapidboard

fields.description: On the task board, issues are marked with a strike-through once it's moved to the right-most swimlane - it would be interesting to mark it with a strike-through on different swimlanes.
fields.summary: Strike-through resolved issues in the Task Board

fields.description:
Currently, any user that can log into JIRA can create a rapid view, and potentially can share it with anyone else if they base it off an existing shared filter.

Ideally we should let them either:

1. Create a rapid view with non-shared filters only

Or

2. Not let them create rapid views if they don't have the above permission.

Even better would be a GH specific permission governing this, but I understand this is not trivial.

Currently, a User A could create a shared filter that everyone can see, then user B without share permissions could create 100+ rapid views based on this filter, that will be shared with everyone and clog up the list of rapid views for everyone.
fields.summary: Rapid View creation should respect create shared objects permission

fields.description: On Rapid Board it seems that issue key gets a strikethrough if there is a resolution on the issue,at least if it is "fixed". However that may be misleading when the issue isn't resolved/closed. There are many reasons why there may be a resolution on cases that has not ended, so there should at least be a possibility to remove this feature on request.
fields.summary: Misleading strikethrough in RapidBoard

fields.description:
We'd like to see the # of hours in the GreenHopper Project Progress Dashboard Gadget. 

It currently just shows # of tasks, but the task board shows # of hours, we'd like the same in the dashboard.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Project Proress dashboard gadget - want to see # of hours rather than tasks # of tasks
Ability to use Quick Filters on the burndown chart
As a user, if an issue I've created is not visible on this Rapid Board the warning dialog should have a link to the issue

fields.description:
Because the field edit is triggered while the browser follows the link. As a result the ajax request for field editing fails.

Expected behaviour: mouse clicks on links inside value (e.g. description) should not start inline editing.

fields.description:
Quick filters in Rapid board should be possible to configure with three states
- Positive (green) 
- Negative (red)
- Passive (none)

Some types of filters may be relevant for both positive and negative filtering. It would be useful to have the possibility to use the same button for both, instead of having several buttons. 
An example: 
Button name: Epic
Positive: issuetype = Epic
Negative: issuetype != Epic

This will make it easier to find a suitable combination of different filters for many occasions. It will also help save space since the alternative today is having both "Show Epic" and "Hide Epic"

Having coloured background on the buttons will also visualize the active filters even more. Today it is easy to see that it is an active filter when focused on, but when focus is further down the page it may be easily overlooked.
fields.summary: Feature request - Rapid Board: Three state quick filters

fields.description:
The TaskBoard is a primary workflow tool for Agile/Scrum teams.

We need to be able to interact with the comments easily from the TaskBoard (currently it requires navigating away from the TaskBoard - bad).

We should have the ability to click a 'comments' link and have a modal popout of the full comment thread for an issue.

We should also be able to post comments in that same modal.

Bonus feature: a comments tooltip showing the recent 3ish comments without even needing a click.

Mantra: No navigation away from the TaskBoard to handle comments!
fields.summary: Comments pop-out in TaskBoard

fields.description:
One failed rank operation (on a db level) and the RankIndexService goes into read-only/blocked mode.

Also, "theoretically" in that specific case it could happen that the first custom field fails with said error (thus creating the transaction but not clearing it out after execution), and subsequently a different rank field is loaded (which will rerun the transaction log). As a result you end up with properly cleaned up transaction log, yet the memory representation of the first rank index has NOT been adapted to reflect that change.

Investigate this possible bug plus decide on the level of hardening we should add to the current code
fields.summary: Harden/fix rank transaction recovery in RankIndexService (x)

fields.summary: Swimlanes for each value in field

fields.description:
On the Rapid Board you can view an issue by clicking on the key. There is inline-editing by a single mouse-click on several fields.

The problem with the single-click to edit-mode is that on fields like summary, description and comments, this prevents the user from being able to use the links in such fields.

An easy solution could be the use a double-click to get to edit-mode instead of the single-click which is now used.

fields.description:
When creating initial quick filters et. al. for a board, we push into the database i18n keys and then resolve them on every request.

Firstly, this has the downside that all user entered data for these entities goes through the i18n resolver for no reason.

Secondly, if two users view the same board they can see things in different languages. This feels strange, particularly given this is not how any user created entities will behave
fields.summary: Database stored data shouldn't go through the i18n resolver

fields.description:
Most fields displayed in a task-card can be edited by the user.  As we restrict which fields can be edited through JIRA (by not placing them on the 'Edit Issue' screens), we would expect GreenHopper to offer similar functionality.  As things stand, a user can bypass our business-logic simply by going to the Planning Board or Task Board and clicking on a field to edit it.

Inline editing can be disabled by removing some of the Actions from GH's atlassian-plugin.xml file, but this doesn't remove the 'Click to Edit' tooltips or the edit icons on the cards.
fields.summary: It should be possible to disable inline-editing on task cards

fields.description:
Hi,

The Agile tab is now made available even without logging in to JIRA. But the behavior is a bit confusing for the users.

When a user is not logged in, and clicks on Agile tab, he is taken to Greenhopper starting page while one would expect to see a login screen.

Also, when session runs out on RapidBoard page, GreenHopper getting started is shown instead of login screen.

So there is actually no clear signal to the user that he is not logged in or needs to login. This is confusing for users.

Regards,
Ruchi

I know the existing burndown chart will only take the last column, and we hope it should be configurable.


Thanks,
Ming
fields.summary: Burndown Chart to burn when resolved

fields.description:
[Migrated from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11667/master-detail-navigation-in-planning-task-boards ]

In the planning and task board, I can bring up a detail view of an issue. (For example, via the "Edit in JIRA" action or the link with tooltip "View this issue in JIRA".)

There used to be an easy, single-click, obvious mechanism to exit the detail view, and return back to the prior context -- via a close button in an easy-to-find corner. No thinking was required.

In 4.4.1, that obvious, single-click mechanism for exiting the detail view seems to have been lost.

Workarounds:

* Use the browser back button to step back until finding the planning or task board.
* Find the "Agile" tab in the middle top, click it. This sends you back to the same board but the first page. Navigate back to the original page.
* Find "More Actions" button in the vast middle, click it, look for "Planning Board" or "Task Board, think about which one we were at before, click it.

Am I missing something? Is there a setting to open the detail view in the old dialog-like manner?

(By the way, I realize JIRA and GreenHopper began as separate products. However, it seems like integration should improve over time.)
fields.summary: Master-detail navigation in planning/task boards

fields.description: Please see https://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-9695.

When this is possible, more flags ( GHS-2526 ) would be nice, e.g. on our current board we use a 'done' flag to remember which issues to move during the standup.

As a user, I should be able to specify the start day of a Sprint. The reality is that you are not always able to have the Sprint Planning meeting on the first day of the Sprint.

For example, we have our Sprint Planning Meetings on the last day of a Sprint, so we are ready to hit the ground running on the first day of the Sprint.

The current flow is not amenable to a high velocity Sprint Planning/Task Breakdown exercise.

Jordan Dea-Mattson

Something along the lines of:
!Screen Shot 2012-02-08 at 10.14.33 AM.png!
fields.summary: As a user I would like a list of the common keyboard shortcuts above the footer

fields.description:
I want a quick filter on the rapid board which allows me to filter by an assignee of my choice. Currently there is only a quick filter for issues assigned to the current user. As a project manager or lead, it is useful to be able to easily see what work is assigned to who.

Instead of a simple button, the user would be presented with a dropdown list or a text field.

Swimlanes could be used for this, but I want to use swimlanes for other purposes while filtering by assignee.

More generally, it would be useful to be able to define quick filters with a variable parameter. That would solve this case and probably others.

{panel:title=Please Note}
This issue refers specifically to having a select style quick filter where the options are a list of existing values, in this case the assignee

This issue is minor because most teams can achieve the same outcome today by using creating JQL quickfilters of the form "assignee = <username>"
{panel}
fields.summary: Quick filter by ANY assignee on the RapidBoard

fields.description: To do backlog grooming across multiple projects, I use the Scrum rapid board plan tab. This should have the same options for looking at the stories as the per project plan board: stories should be shown with the 'List view' card style, not whatever it is now (I would think the 'Compact List' card style, but it doesn't even show story points, making planning sprints impossible).
fields.summary: As PO I want to see more than the summary on the Plan tab of the Scrum rapid board

fields.description: When there is an JS error in Rapid Board, it often show big Red bar with "internal Server Error" message. The detail error message should be logged and display in the Error page.
fields.summary: Rapid Roard JavaScript Error Should Show More Detail instead of Big Red Box

fields.description: Facebook used to do this (they now have a tickbox to opt-in to quick reply mode), we should at least consider someway of demonstrating that multi-line input is possible.
fields.summary: As a new user, I'd like some way to know that shift+enter is how I enter new lines into multiline fields so I can that thing I said.

fields.description:
If you grab a issue and drag it upwards say in a very long list and then you relaise that you dont want to do it then today its TOO LATE.

It will drop somewhere and most likely where you dont want ti


So we need to respect ESCAPE and then cancel the drag effective and leave it where is was.

I was doing this on JAC with our large backlog and it was a bad UX
fields.summary: As a user I would like to use the escape key to cancel a drag and drop operation on the plan or work mode

fields.description:
I did this on default JIRA 4.4

I viwed a rapid board and then click on create issue

I got the following JS followed by the spinner over the top
fields.summary: JavaScript errors when click on Create Issue

fields.description:
Currently JIRA loses certain REST exceptions.  And although this will be fixed in a future version, they still wont ever turn up in the atlasssian-greenhopper.log

So we need to capture them ourselves
fields.summary: As an adminstrator I would like REST errors to be in atlassian-greenhopper.log

fields.description:
The new UI that splits the comments into a new tab seems less useful than the previous versions.

When users are clicking through issues, the thing they want to check is what's the latest status, and that's usually in the comments.

Showing the number of comments in the tab is nice but doesn't convey to me useful information because users don't remember what the previous count was.

Sorry if this is filed under the wrong issue type, I was looking for Improvement but looks like that is gone.
fields.summary: Show comments upon first click in RapidBoard view

fields.description: Currently, when creating a card from Greenhopper, it will display by default the last issue type created, it would be great to have an option to set a default issue type(most used) for Greenhopper cards specifically, so people don't have to switch the type everytime.
fields.summary: Ability to change the default issue type for new cards.
Report mode should warn user if there are no columns/swimlanes selected (and hence no issues appear)
As a user, I'd like to be able to create a project and Scrum rapid board at once like I can for Kanban
In Doco: I would like to see Rapid Board everywhere Rapid View is currently
As a user, I would like to just see Rapid Board everywhere Rapid View exists currently

fields.description:
I would like to be able to drag and drop issues across swimlanes to re-categorize issues. Parse the JQL used to define a swimline, and update the subject issue to make the it match.

Example use case:

With swimlanes defined as follows:
||Swimlane A||priority=High AND assignee=engineering|
||Swimlane B||priority=Medium AND assignee=support|
||Swimlane C||priority=Low AND assignee=sales|

Dragging an issue from Swimlane B and dropping it in Swimlane A should update the issue's priority to High and the assignee to engineering. Likewise, dragging an issue from Swimline A and dropping it in Swimlane C should update the issue's priority to Low and the assignee to sales.
fields.summary: Ability to update issues using drag and drop between swimlanes

fields.description: Both fields probably belong to the Issue Detail head section?
fields.summary: Add issue type as configurable field for Issue Detail View

fields.description: KB navigation is just not an option in GH. Broken links galore.
fields.summary: As a user who can't use a mouse (or just a poweruser), I would an accessible product so I can use it.

fields.description: Slightly annoying
fields.summary: First use of story point field takes long time (~15 seconds)
